objtitle.title: Rough Sketch of Two or Three Figures in a Landscape

objdescid.compdate: c. 1780-85The date is based on stylistic considerations.

objinfo.medium: pencilThe pencil inscription just above the lower edge of the leaf—"Sketch / by Blake R. A."—is not by Blake.

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Early history unknown; acquired by Alice G. E. Carthew by 1918; bequeathed by Carthew to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) in 1940.

desc.objtitle:
Rough Sketch of Two or Three Figures in a Landscape,
object 1 (Butlin 123 verso)

objnote.p: The pencil inscription just above the lower edge of the leaf—"Sketch / by Blake R. A."—is not by Blake. He was never a member of the Royal Academy, although he exhibited there. For the monochrome wash drawing on the recto of this leaf, see The Good Farmer, Butlin 123 recto. The leaf is stained browned upper and center right.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Just left of center in this very faint drawing, three figures, sitting or kneeling, are partially visible. The central figure is the most detailed and appears to face forward with head tilted up and to the left. This figure's right arm may be bent at the elbow. Both legs of this sitting figure are extended downward and may be crossed near the ankle. To the right of this figure, a second figure's head and arms, both of which are bent upward at 90 degrees, are visible. This figure may clench its hands into fists. The figure far left sits or kneels facing right, with left arm raised at 135 degrees and right arm lowered at 45 degrees. All three may be engaged in an animated conversation. There is a form behind and above the figure on the left (perhaps a tree?) though the details of this form are indistinct. Additional lines above and to the right of the figures may represent a mountain landscape. A few faint lines upper right might represent two(?) kneeling figures, oriented vertically and facing right toward the bottom of the leaf.

component.illusobjdesc: Just left of center of this very faint drawing, three figures are partially visible. The central figure is the most detailed and appears to sit facing forward with head tilted up and to the left. This figure's right arm may be bent at the elbow. Both legs are extended downward and may be crossed near the ankle.

Just left of center of this very faint drawing, three figures are partially visible. On the right, a figure's head and arms, both of which are bent upward at 90 degrees, are visible. This figure may clench its hands into fists. He may be seated.

Just left of center of this very faint drawing, three figures are partially visible. The figure far left sits or kneels facing right, with left arm raised at 135 degrees and right arm lowered at 45 degrees.
There is a form behind and above the figure at far left (perhaps a tree?) though the details of this form are indistinct.
Lines above and to the right of the figures may represent a mountain landscape.
A few faint lines upper right might represent two(?) kneeling figures, oriented vertically and facing right toward the bottom of the leaf.
